channel.title: Core Java
channel.description:
It has come to my concern that over 95% of people that try to run a server do not know anything about Java.
You guys are NOT going to succeed by just editing prices coordients or adding codes from other people.
You need to learn the cores! to have a full conceptual understanding of what you doing.
You are dealing with one of the most used language in the World Wide.
Get to know it before asking stupid questions.
Thank you for understanding me.
twins.
P.S.
Read this:
http://www.freejavaguide.com/

item.title: Core Java
item.dc:creator: @twins twins
item.description:
@twins wrote:

[quote=“the1337legend, post:29, topic:300511”]Java is the reason i stick to coding with Turing, because it’s easy and makes me feel like im going somewhere (l0l), and why i was thinking of starting either c#, cause i really would like to learn to make some decent programs and shit, but although if i ever wanted a career regarding coding, e.g game studio’s it’d take c++ which i obviously would have more of a problem with than i do with java(java only b.c the tarts who ‘organized’ it, did a shitty job, and is hard for me to learn/write with everything all spread out and just slapped on random parts of a file,my opinion, not yours).

but ill look into that tutorial, see if i gain any knowledge :), i still have to start using booleans more and learn what they fully mean / do, so yes, i’m not that far at all, just so far, i’ve coded quite a few games on turing, e.g a low mario cart game, one of the old mario games where you’d hit the POW things and have to kill all the lil turtles that walked across your screen, all without using a boolean (unless followed a small rough tutorial on what to do [non spoonfed]).[/quote]

Alright, if you need more help pm me.

Read full topic

but ill look into that tutorial, see if i gain any knowledge :), i still have to start using booleans more and learn what they fully mean / do, so yes, i’m not that far at all, just so far, i’ve coded quite a few games on turing, e.g a low mario cart game, one of the old mario games where you’d hit the POW things and have to kill all the lil turtles that walked across your screen, all without using a boolean (unless followed a small rough tutorial on what to do [non spoonfed]).
